definition: a statistical relation between two or more variables such that systematic changes in the value of one variable are accompanied by systematic changes in the other
details:
noun
- a statistical relation between two or more variables such that systematic changes in the value of one variable are accompanied by systematic changes in the other
= synonyms: correlational statistics
- a statistic representing how closely two variables co-vary
= example: a statistic representing how closely two variables co-vary
= synonyms: correlation coefficient, coefficient of correlation
- a reciprocal relation between two or more things
= synonyms: correlativity
